str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Saul, the apostle. Of Hebrew origin, the same as Saoul; Saulus, the Jewish name of Paul.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To fill, fulfill, complete. A prolonged form of a primary pleo to 'fill' (imbue, influence, supply); specially, to fulfil.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To direct my gaze, look steadily. From a compound of a and teino; to gaze intently.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
